comment: Lundy is awesome. Three assignments, 3 page paper, 10 min presentation with same topic as paper and a textbook quiz. Attendance a must points are given. interesting class I never been in a class where everyone's hands were up to give their opinion. Take Him!!
Paying attention in class was not really required at all. 50% of the grade was based on a presentation and if you read the chapter in the textbook and did a little research then you did fine.

Attendance and participation are worth 40% of your grade, so show up! His tests are multiple choice and one short essay that he gives you beforehand. You MUST do the assigned readings. They consist of 50% of his test questions. Read, show up, do the 2 projects (also easy) and you will pass with flying colors. His class feels like 6th grade though.

Dr. Lundy is awesome. You can really tell he loves his field and loves teaching it. However, sometimes i felt he got a little TOO excited and went a kinda fast, but its better than being boring i guess. 2 tests, 1 group project, and 1 ethnography paper. Read the articles assigned for the test! Attendance is big part of grade!
Wonderful professor. I want to take all his classes. Your grade depends on attendance, but you will enjoy every bit. Excellent class notes are pretty much all you need to pass this class. Take him!

Made learning Anthropology easy! Thank goodness because some professors sometimes forget when they teach an introduction class that it's just that an introduction class! Tests are hard but he reviews in class before test so that helps. Highly recommended!

Prof. Lundy is very nice! Because of his intro course I am now an Anthropology major. His tests are difficult but he does reviews in class that are exactly the test questions. You have assigned reading that are very interesting. 4 test and no final. He is a nice interesting guy. TAKE HIM

Very nice guy. Pretty clearly explained his expectations & assignments for the course. The topics we discussed were interesting & he did pop quizzes randomly. Readings assigned were important for multiple choice exams. He did reviews before tests w/ actual test questions. Very fair grader. Didn't like the groups he would put us into sometimes.

New teacher at KSU. He is nice, but can sometimes come off as being rude or making comments that are unprofessional. Class is mandatory, and there are powerpoints, pop/regular quizzes, midterm, ethnography project as well as a final project. He grades easy, and although he sets guidelines for the class, he doesn't factor in the other requirements n

This class is an extremely easy A as long as you do the work. There is plenty to do including lots of reading, a paper,and a presentation, but he is an easy grader. As long as you are willing to put in a little bit of effort your grade will be fine -- if not he offers some opportunity for extra credit.
